metadata.title: Comprehensive Assessment Plan for RHEL 9 - ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 SL-4

control-selections.description: All applicable controls for an SL-4 baseline for RHEL 9, covering SL-1 through SL-4.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.1 & RE(1,2): Human User Identification, Uniqueness, and MFA
assessment-activities.description: Assesses RHEL 9's integration with a central IdP via SSSD to enforce unique, multi-factor authentication for all human users.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the `/etc/sssd/sssd.conf` file to verify integration with the documented central IdP (e.g., Active Directory, IdM).
**Interview:** Interview the IdP administrator to confirm that MFA policies are enforced for the user groups permitted to access the RHEL 9 systems.
**Test:** Attempt to SSH into the RHEL 9 host with a valid user. Verify the system requires and validates an MFA token.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.5 & RE(1): Authenticator Management and Hardware Security
assessment-activities.description: Assesses how RHEL 9 protects authenticators at rest using LUKS full-disk encryption, optionally backed by a TPM.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Anaconda kickstart file or installation procedure documentation to verify that LUKS full-disk encryption is specified.
**Test:** On the running RHEL 9 host, run `lsblk` and verify that the root filesystem is mounted on a `luks` device type.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-2.1 & RE(1,2): Authorization and Least Privilege
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the use of SELinux and file permissions to enforce least privilege.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `sestatus` and verify that SELinux is in `enforcing` mode. Review the output of `ls -lZ /etc` to verify that critical configuration files have restrictive SELinux contexts and user/group ownership.

**Test:** Log in as a non-privileged user. Attempt to read a sensitive file (e.g., `/etc/shadow`) and attempt to write to a system directory (e.g., `/etc`). Verify both actions are denied by file permissions and logged by SELinux in the audit log.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-2.8: Auditable Events
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the configuration of the audit daemon (`auditd`) and log forwarding.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the contents of `/etc/audit/rules.d/` to verify that the audit rules align with the organizational baseline. Examine the configuration of `rsyslog` or `fluentd` to verify it is configured to forward audit logs to the central SIEM.

**Test:** As a non-privileged user, attempt to access a protected file. Search the central SIEM for the corresponding `SYSCALL` event from the host's audit log and verify the subject, object, action, and result are correctly recorded.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-3.4 & RE(1,2): Software and Information Integrity
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the use of AIDE for file integrity monitoring.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the `/etc/aide.conf` file to verify it is configured to monitor critical system binaries, libraries, and configuration files.

**Test:** Manually modify a monitored file (e.g., `/etc/ssh/sshd_config`). Run `aide --check` and verify that the change is detected. Check the SIEM for the corresponding alert triggered by the scheduled AIDE scan.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-4.3: Use of Cryptography (FIPS)
assessment-activities.description: Assesses if FIPS mode is enabled on the host.

steps.description: **Test:** Run `fips-mode-setup --check` on the RHEL 9 host and verify the output indicates FIPS mode is enabled.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-5.1: Network Segmentation
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the firewall configuration on the host.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `firewall-cmd --list-all` to verify that the active firewall rules implement a default-deny policy and only permit traffic on explicitly allowed services and ports.
**Test:** From an external machine, attempt to connect to a non-essential port on the RHEL 9 host and verify the connection is blocked by `firewalld`.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-7.2: Resource Management
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the use of systemd slices to manage resources for critical services.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the systemd unit file for a critical service (e.g., `sshd.service`). Verify that it is assigned to a specific systemd slice with defined CPU and memory limits.

**Test:** Induce high load on a non-critical service and monitor the resource usage of a critical service. Verify that the critical service's CPU and memory usage remain within their allocated limits and that the service remains responsive.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-7.7: Least Functionality
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the installed package set against the approved baseline.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Anaconda kickstart file or image blueprint to verify the package list contains only essential packages.
**Test:** Run an Ansible playbook in check mode that compares the installed packages on the host (`rpm -qa`) against the approved list. Verify the check reports no deviations.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment of Compensating Controls
assessment-activities.description: Assesses compensating controls for requirements not met by the operating system.

steps.description: **Interview:** Interview the data center manager to discuss physical security measures (cages, surveillance).
**Interview:** Interview an infrastructure engineer to confirm that UEFI Secure Boot is enabled in the BIOS for the host server.
**Test:** Conduct a controlled test of the data center's UPS and generator systems.
